sen.j: 12世紀に入る頃から、国衙は本格的に荘園拡大対策に取り組み始めた。
sen.e: From the beginning of the twelfth century, kokuga began to put in serious efforts to tackle the expansion of shoen.

sen.j: 名田や別名などを単位として、国衙領を郡・郷・保・条などの租税収取単位へと再編成していった。
sen.e: They reorganized Kokugaryo (territories governed by provincial government office) by dividing it into units of taxation, such as Gun (country), Go (village), Ho (district) and Jo (street), each of which had originally been the myoden or the bechimyo.

sen.j: また、国衙も、安定した官物収入を確保するために、田堵負名と特定の名田の半永続的な関係を認めるようになった。
sen.e: Therefore, kokuga, who also needed to stabilize their income by the kanmotsu, came to approve the semi permanent relationship between tato fumyo and specific myoden.

sen.e: In this way, the tato fumyo class became capable of fixing their rights to specific myoden, and it helped tato fumyo to develop into myoshu (owner of rice fields).
